TopicTitle: [1.2 - 1.4] Modular Rocket Systems v1.13.2 (2018-03-12) - Stock-alike Parts Pack

Articles.Content: I have a suggestion, you should add tweakscale support.

I'd like to see other stock-a-like options for the FTX-2 Fuel Duct, especially a Cryogenic Orange one and a Plain White one for starters. Possibly Gold Foil and Copernicus style too.

I'll have to look, but I think it's not possible without a plugin. Last I looked at the configs for them, they didn't have anything special in the way of modules determining what they do. I think they're special cases, hardcoded into the game.

I have a suggestion, you should add tweakscale support.

Huh, might have to look into that.

I've been very productive today. It's taken a good number of hours, but I put together my most complex part modeling project so far. A 4x nuclear engine. Yay! I think it's turning out great.
That looks really good. Are the fairings four times as deadly as the stock single?

That looks really good. Are the fairings four times as deadly as the stock single?

No, the fairing is 100% less deadly! It functions like the fairings on regular chemical engines, instead of being ejected panels like the LV-N.
I got to have those! I'm currently planning my first grand tour. I will be eagerly awaiting you next release.

It's great that the parts you're making are pretty much fractions or multiples of stock parts (like that big nuke is 4 LV-Ns, both in specs and appearance). Doesn't feel like they give an unfair advantage over stock aside from reducing part counts.

It's great that the parts you're making are pretty much fractions or multiples of stock parts (like that big nuke is 4 LV-Ns, both in specs and appearance). Doesn't feel like they give an unfair advantage over stock aside from reducing part counts.

Yep, I think that's really the ideal way to make sure the parts stay stock-balanced.

I have a suggestion, you should add tweakscale support.

I've started adding the configs for this. v0.4 should have support for it.

Edited September 13, 2014 by NecroBones

I've started adding the configs for this. v0.4 should have support for it.
5 meter quad nuke...yeah that ought to be good for a grand tour lol
You have been too quiet Necro. What are you getting into now?

You have been too quiet Necro. What are you getting into now?

Heh, I didn't get much time to work on things over the weekend. I have some of the jet parts in progress though. Hopefully I'll have a screenshot or two tonight.

I think I'll be able to release this next update pretty shortly. I'll post another update when I do.

Added several parts in 0.625m. Two lengths of jet fuel tanks, a turbojet, ram air intake, and a matching intake at 1.25m.

Screenshots from new small jet stuff:

I think I'll be able to release this next update pretty shortly. I'll post another update when I do.

OK, version 0.4 is up!

I love this pack. The docking collars are things of beauty.

Awesome, glad you like them!

Hey Bones... Any thoughts on making 2.5 meter wide jets/intakes/RAPIERs? ;-D

Not here to demand anything, just throwing in ideas! :]
This pack just gets better and better. Thanks 'Bones.

Hey Bones... Any thoughts on making 2.5 meter wide jets/intakes/RAPIERs? ;-D

Not here to demand anything, just throwing in ideas! :]
Multumesc! Thanks NB! Now I will have to resolve myself to making a VTOL that actually works.
Hey man, love the parts. Quick question, where is the TweakScale config at?

Hey man, love the parts. Quick question, where is the TweakScale config at?

The tweakscale configs are in all of the individual part.cfg files. It looks like this doesn't break anything when the mod isn't installed.

This pack has become a must for me. Excellent parts that look stock and fill niche roles that are otherwise missing.

Love the nosecones. If I could request one thing, it would be a 0.625m nosecone (because I don't like the stock one), although TweakScale support sort of takes care of that anyways.

Thanks very much for this mod.

Edited September 16, 2014 by Masetto

Thanks, glad you're enjoying it! Yep, a small nose cone is on my list. The stock one is asymmetrical, since it's meant for aircraft. So that's something I've been meaning to add.

Cool. Yeah, don't know why I didn't think to look there. Ã°Å¸ËœÂ

lol, no worries.

OK, tonight's update (I was very productive!):

A "three-quarter jumbo" tank, with flag decals:

Size-2 ASAS module. As Red pointed out a little while ago, the stock one uses size-0 attachment nodes, which is a bit of an oversight. To make this new one meaningful, not only does it use the size-2 nodes, but it's also 20% beefier than the stock one, in terms of mass, cost, and torque. So in effect, for every 5 of them, you would need 6 of the stock modules to achieve the same thing. But the cost in both funds and mass is the same, per unit of torque. The exterior is a scaled down version of the 3.75m one I made previously, but the "interior" is remodeled and re-textured.

Aerodynamic structural pylons. All three use the same model and texture, to save on memory (and development time). They provide a little lift, but mainly are meant for holding attachments. Shown with the 0.625m LFO fuel tanks I made:

Also tweaked the appearance of the quad-nuke. Lightened the grey color of the reactors to be closer to the stock one. Also enlarged the engine bell by 9% (as high as I could go without moving its position, and still fit inside the space I allocated with the fairing, so it doesn't break savegames). I think the new proportions look pretty good (especially when you consider that wide bells make a lot of sense for vacuum use).

Edited September 17, 2014 by NecroBones

Tonight, a little more progress toward 0.5.

Added some white stripes to the 3.75m monopropellant tank. Made a 0.625m nose cone, and also added 0.625m basic jet parts (intake and engine) to go with the turbojet versions already released. Also reworked the aerodynamic pylons a little over what I did last night (mainly making them shorter and thicker).

Edited September 18, 2014 by NecroBones
